overview: From 2025-06-29 to 2025-07-06, elizaos-plugins/plugin-twitter had 2 new PRs (1 merged), 4 new issues, and 14 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Twitter Client Initialization Error
topIssues.author: Ovodo
topIssues.body:
I  am getting the error below on creating / starting my agent using the twitter plugin.
It says successfully Authenticated but then i am getting a client initialization error.
Take a look at the image below.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/23235ba6-1595-4bb8-bd01-5b192458ca3a)

topIssues.title: It looks like elizaos calling the old method of twitter plugin
topIssues.author: nccuong-vikki
topIssues.body: ``` [2025-07-03 01:22:59] ERROR: Error fetching search tweets: message: "(Error) fetchSearchTweets is deprecated. Use searchTweets generator instead." stack: [ "Error: fetchSearchTweets is deprecated. Use searchTweets generator instead.", "at fetchSearchTweets (file:///home/ba/nami/node_modules/@elizaos/plugin-twitter/dist/index.js:799:9)", "at Client.fetchSearchTweets (file:///home/ba/nami/node_modules/@elizaos/plugin-twitter/dist/index.js:1928:12)", "at file:///home/ba/nami/node_modules/@elizaos/plugin-twitter/dist/index.js:2868:32", "at file:///home/ba/nami/node_modules/@elizaos/plugin-twitter/dist/index.js:2551:32", "at RequestQueue.processQueue (file:///home/ba/nami/node_modules/@elizaos/plugin-twitter/dist/index.js:2573:15)", "at file:///home/ba/nami/node_modules/@elizaos/plugin-twitter/dist/index.js:2557:12", "at new Promise ()", "at RequestQueue.add (file:///home/ba/nami/node_modules/@elizaos/plugin-twitter/dist/index.js:2548:12)", "at _ClientBase.fetchSearchTweets (file:///home/ba/nami/node_modules/@elizaos/plugin-twitter/dist/index.js:2866:48)", "at TwitterInteractionClient.handleTwitterInteractions (file:///home/ba/nami/node_modules/@elizaos/plugin-twitter/dist/index.js:7380:46)" ] ``` I met this error while trying to run twitter plugin, read the `node_modules/@elizaos/plugin-twitter/dist/index.js`, the method `fetchSearchTweets` throw the error on purpose, so I believe that elizaos main is calling the old method of twitter plugin

topIssues.title: Test coverage & setup - Switch from vitest setup to working bun setup
topIssues.author: ai16z-demirix
topIssues.body:
Current test coverage exists and it is with old vitest setup. 
We could switch to bun and working setup, with coverage, tests, needed mocks to follow elizaos setup

topIssues.title: TWITTER_MAX_INTERACTIONS_PER_RUN is documented but never used
topIssues.author: myst4
topIssues.body:
## üêõ Bug Report

The plugin defines an environment variable:

````
TWITTER_MAX_INTERACTIONS_PER_RUN=10  # Maximum interactions processed per cycle
````

However, this value is **never used anywhere in the code**. Specifically, the `handleTimeline()` function retrieves 20 tweets via `this.getTimeline(20)`, and for each tweet, the agent may perform up to 4 actions: `[LIKE]`, `[RETWEET]`, `[QUOTE]`, `[REPLY]`.

In practice, this can result in **40‚Äì60 actions being executed in a single run**, all at once.

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Problem

- The defined variable `maxActionsPerCycle = 20` inside the code is never enforced.
- The system does not limit or throttle the number of actions performed per run.
- All actions are executed immediately and in parallel, with no spacing or delay.
- This behavior may **violate Twitter‚Äôs automation rules** and can result in accounts being rate-limited or banned.

---

## ‚ùì Open Question

Given that `TWITTER_MAX_INTERACTIONS_PER_RUN` is documented as a limit, but not used anywhere in the code ‚Äî is this an oversight, or is the intended behavior to handle rate-limiting differently?

Shouldn‚Äôt there be a safeguard in place to avoid executing dozens of actions in a single cycle?

topPRs.title: üöÄ Twitter Plugin: Complete Migration to API v2 & Major Cleanup
topPRs.author: ChristopherTrimboli
topPRs.body:
# üöÄ Twitter Plugin: Complete Migration to API v2 & Major Cleanup

## Overview

This PR completes the migration of the Twitter plugin from unofficial GraphQL endpoints to the official Twitter API v2, removes ~3,500+ lines of legacy code, and fixes critical authentication issues that were causing 403 errors.

## Background

The Twitter plugin was using a problematic mix of:
- Unofficial GraphQL endpoints (requiring hardcoded bearer tokens)
- Legacy timeline fetching methods
- Deprecated authentication patterns
- Inconsistent error handling

This was causing:
- 403 authentication errors
- Confusion between OAuth 1.0a and OAuth 2.0
- Maintenance burden from legacy code
- Type safety issues

## Changes Made

### 1. üîÑ Complete API v2 Migration
- ‚úÖ Migrated timeline fetching to `client.v2.homeTimeline()`
- ‚úÖ Replaced profile fetching with `client.v2.userByUsername()` and `client.v2.user()`
- ‚úÖ Updated followers/following to use `client.v2.following()` and `client.v2.followers()`
- ‚úÖ Converted tweet posting to use `client.v2.tweet()`
- ‚úÖ Removed all GraphQL query endpoints and unofficial API calls
- ‚úÖ Eliminated `requestApi` function and hardcoded bearer tokens

### 2. üóëÔ∏è Massive Code Cleanup
**Deleted Files (7 files, ~3,000 lines):**
- `timeline-v1.ts`
- `timeline-v2.ts` 
- `timeline-async.ts`
- `timeline-list.ts`
- `timeline-relationship.ts`
- `timeline-search.ts`
- `timeline-tweet-util.ts`
- `api.ts` (GraphQL utilities)

**Removed:**
- `rest_id` references throughout the codebase
- `parseTweet` method (no longer needed with v2 API)
- `TimelineArticle` type and `getArticle` method
- Deprecated `withCookie()` and `withXCsrfToken()` methods
- `parseTweetV2ToV1` conversion complexity

### 3. üîß Type System Improvements
- Fixed boolean vs string handling for environment variables
- Added proper type checking for OAuth credentials
- Removed unnecessary type conversions
- Fixed async generator type annotations

### 4. üìù Documentation Overhaul
Completely rewrote README.md with:
- TL;DR quick start section
- Visual credential guide (ASCII art showing exact fields)
- Step-by-step setup with Twitter Developer Portal navigation
- Common error troubleshooting (#1: 403 errors)
- Clear OAuth 1.0a vs OAuth 2.0 distinction

### 5. üõ°Ô∏è Error Handling Standardization
**New file:** `utils/error-handler.ts`
- Categorized errors (AUTH, RATE_LIMIT, API, NETWORK, MEDIA, VALIDATION)
- Consistent logging patterns
- Retry logic helpers
- Fixed unsafe `error.message` access throughout

### 6. üêõ Bug Fixes
- Fixed `TWITTER_POST_ENABLE` not being recognized
- Fixed tweet posting working correctly with v2 API
- Fixed timeline fetching with proper v2 response handling
- Added safe error message access with optional chaining

## Testing
- ‚úÖ Successfully authenticated with Twitter API v2
- ‚úÖ Posted tweet automatically (ID: 1941244370935783846)
- ‚úÖ Timeline fetching working correctly
- ‚úÖ No more 403 errors with proper OAuth 1.0a credentials

## Breaking Changes
- Requires Twitter API v1.1 access (for OAuth 1.0a)
- No longer supports cookie-based authentication
- Media upload temporarily unavailable (v2 API limitation)

## Known Limitations & Future Work
1. **Media Upload**: Not implemented in twitter-api-v2 library yet
2. **MENTION_RECEIVED Event**: Temporarily disabled pending proper implementation
3. **Thread Processing**: Referenced tweets need full v2 API implementation
4. **Retweeters Endpoint**: Not available in current v2 API wrapper

## Migration Guide for Users
1. Ensure your Twitter app has "Read and write" permissions
2. Use OAuth 1.0a credentials (NOT OAuth 2.0):
   - API Key & Secret (from "Consumer Keys")
   - Access Token & Secret (from "Authentication Tokens")
3. Regenerate Access Token after changing permissions
4. Add callback URL: `http://localhost:3000/callback`

## Impact
- **Lines removed**: ~3,500+
- **Files deleted**: 8
- **Code coverage**: Improved with standardized error handling
- **Maintenance burden**: Significantly reduced
- **Type safety**: Enhanced throughout

## Review Notes
- All tests passing
- No linter errors
- Backward compatible for existing users (just need correct credentials)
- Ready for production use

---

This is a major cleanup that makes the Twitter plugin more maintainable, reliable, and aligned with Twitter's official API. The removal of unofficial GraphQL endpoints ensures long-term stability and compliance with Twitter's terms of service.

Fixes #[issue-number] (403 authentication errors)

topPRs.title: feat: Issue #34 - switching test setup to bun
topPRs.author: ai16z-demirix
topPRs.body:
Issue related: https://github.com/elizaos-plugins/plugin-twitter/issues/34
- Migrated the Twitter plugin tests from Vitest to the Bun test runner
- Replaced Vitest-specific APIs with Bun's native testing utilities
- Created and enhanced mocks for the @elizaos/core module to support Bun's mocking system
- Added ChannelType enum and UUID type exports to mocks for test compatibility
- Fixed TypeScript compatibility issues in the e2e tests with a UUID utility function
- Implemented type assertions for IAgentRuntime compatibility in e2e tests
- Updated all test commands and documentation in TESTING_GUIDE.md and README.md
- Added a dedicated documentation section explaining the Bun mocking approach
- Added documentation about TypeScript compatibility fixes for UUID template literals
- Pushed all changes to the fix/issue-34 branch with all tests now passing under Bun

<!-- This is an auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->
## Summary by CodeRabbit

* **Chores**
  * Migrated all tests from Vitest to Bun's native test runner.
  * Updated test scripts and dependencies to use Bun, removing Vitest-related packages.
  * Added Bun-specific configuration and type support.
  * Introduced a global test setup file and updated documentation to reflect the new testing approach.

* **Documentation**
  * Revised the testing guide to detail Bun test runner usage, setup, and new mocking strategies.

* **Tests**
  * Updated all test files to use Bun's testing and mocking APIs.
  * Enhanced type safety in tests with stricter UUID typing and helper functions.
  * Adjusted test assertions and mocks for compatibility with Bun.
<!-- end of auto-generated comment: release notes by coderabbit.ai -->

# üöÄ Twitter Plugin: Complete Migration to API v2 & Major Cleanup

## Overview

This PR completes the migration of the Twitter plugin from unofficial GraphQL endpoints to the official Twitter API v2, removes ~3,500+ lines of legacy code

topContributors.summary: wtfsayo: Had a highly active week in the `elizaos/eliza` repository, merging 23 pull requests with a focus on bug fixes, new features, and UI improvements. Key contributions included a significant fix for GUI version resolution (+583/-193 lines in elizaos/eliza#5339), a redesign of the agent cards homepage (+443/-398 lines in elizaos/eliza#5344), and several CLI enhancements. In addition to opening 6 new pull requests, they were highly collaborative with 115 commits and 34 comments on other pull requests.

tcm390: Merged 35 pull requests in elizaos/eliza, delivering a mix of UI features and bug fixes for components like avatars, agent cards, and the side bar. This work was done consistently over 5 days, totaling 107 commits and +2,971/-2,512 lines of code changes. They also approved one pull request and have another feature PR currently open (elizaos/eliza#5347).

SYMBaiEX: This week's main contribution was a massive documentation overhaul in `elizaos/eliza`, merging PR #5401 which introduced over 43,000 lines of content. They also merged a significant CLI refactor in PR #5359, with their total work spanning 53 commits and modifying 367 files (+48851/-16057). Additionally, SYMBaiEX opened three new pull requests, created one issue, and provided several code reviews and comments.

ai16z-demirix: Merged 3 pull requests in the elizaos/eliza repository, including a major effort to set up a new testing framework in elizaos/eliza#5368 (+1166/-1518 lines). They also opened one new PR (elizaos/eliza#5415), created two related issues, and provided several code reviews and comments. This week's work involved 12 commits across 47 files, with a primary focus on configuration, documentation, and tests.

ChristopherTrimboli: Merged a major refactor of the CLI environment in elizaos/eliza#5326 (+2050/-1166 lines) and also updated plugin documentation in elizaos/eliza#5408. They opened one new pull request (elizaos/eliza#5330) and approved 3 others. Overall, work was spread across 3 days this week.

yungalgo merged three pull requests in elizaos/eliza to fix the command-line interface, with the largest being elizaos/eliza#5321 (+896/-167 lines). They continued this work by opening two new PRs for CLI fixes and making 36 commits across 43 files (+622/-269 lines). Additionally, yungalgo was active in code review, providing two reviews and eight comments on pull requests.

0xbbjoker merged four pull requests in elizaos/eliza, highlighted by a major feature for plugin upgrades that added over 26,300 lines of code (elizaos/eliza#5311). Other merged work included bug fixes and logging improvements, and they also provided five PR reviews and five comments. This work was spread across 15 commits, showing a very consistent activity pattern over five days.
odilitime: Pushed a single commit that modified one file (+81/-1 lines).
0xtc23: No activity this week.
Dangoz: Merged a substantial bug fix in elizaos/eliza#5343 (+29872/-3864 lines) to handle unwrapped server responses. This was their primary contribution, with activity on two days this week.
mountdisk: Merged one pull request in elizaos/eliza#5317 to fix minor issues in documentation comments (+5/-5 lines).

standujar: Focused on bug fixes this week, merging one PR in elizaos/eliza#5384 to remove duplicate middleware (+176/-416 lines). Activity was sporadic, with all contributions, including two commits and one PR comment, occurring on a single day.
reallesee: Merged one pull request in elizaos/eliza (#5412) to update a GitHub Actions dependency, modifying test files (+12/-13 lines).

borisudovicic: Created six issues in the elizaos/eliza repository. These issues covered planning for plugin upgrades (elizaos/eliza#5341), new features like security roles (elizaos/eliza#5386), and reviews of existing functionality (elizaos/eliza#5377, #5375).
linear: Created two issues in the elizaos/eliza repository: elizaos/eliza#5325 and elizaos/eliza#5336.

bealers: Focused on bug fixes this week, modifying 5 files (+164/-506 lines) in a single commit. Active on one day, they also provided one code review and left comments on two issues and four pull requests.
github-advanced-security: Activity was limited to a single pull request review comment.

iQiexie: Focused on documentation feedback by creating issue elizaos/eliza#5370 to report misleading REST API documentation. They also contributed to discussions with one pull request comment and one issue comment.
gcbsumid opened one issue this week, elizaos/eliza#5407, reporting a failure to load plugins.
samarth30: This week's only contribution was opening issue elizaos/eliza#5376 to discuss a hybrid approach for plugin migration.
